Detailed Description

Creates a tilesets of Textures, useful for animation.

Stores a number of Texture objects and can render any of them. The class is based off of code found in Jim Adams' Programming Role Playing Games with DirectX.

Member Function Documentation

BOOL Tile::Create ( GraphicsCore *  Graphics,
long  NumTextures 
)

Create a Tileset, with the specified number of textures.

Parameters:
Graphics The parent GraphicsCore object.
NumTextures The number of texture that this Tileset will have
Returns:
TRUE if the tileset is created successfully.

BOOL Tile::Load ( long  TextureNum,
char *  Filename,
short  TileWidth,
short  TileHeight 
)

Load a tileset from File into one of the texture slots created using Tile::Create().

Parameters:
TextureNum Index of the texture to be loaded
Filename Filename of the texture to load
TileWidth width of the tiles in FileName.
TileHeight height of the tiles if FileName. NOTE: The tiles in any file are assumed to be the same size.

BOOL Tile::Draw ( long  TextureNum,
long  TileNum,
float  ScreenX,
float  ScreenY,
D3DCOLOR  Color = 0xFFFFFFFF,
float  XScale = 1.0f,
float  YScale = 1.0f,
float  rotationCenterX = 0.0f,
float  rotationCenterY = 0.0f,
double  angle = 0.0f 
)

Draw the specified tile from the specified tileset onto the screen, using the Texture::Blit().

Parameters:
TextureNum The index of the Texture from the tileset.
TileNum The number of the tile in the tileset. The tiles are numbered left-to-right, top-bottom, starting with 0.
ScreenX x-coordinate at which we draw the tile.
ScreenY y-coordinate at which we draw the tile.
Color The transparent color in this tile.
XScale Scale to draw the tile.
YScale Scale to draw the tile.
